sentence.Network_cn: 贫穷的郊区在传统上构成了支持该党的牢固基础。

entry.def: The bedrock of something is the principles, ideas, or facts on which it is based.

example.ex: Mutual trust is the bedrock of a relationship...
Working-class voters form the bedrock of Labour's support.
example.tran: 工薪阶层选民是支持工党的基本力量。

entry.def: Bedrock is the solid rock in the ground which supports all the soil above it.

example.ex: It took five years to drill down to bedrock.
example.tran: 耗时五年才钻到了基岩。

means.word_mean: 1. solid unweathered rock lying beneath surface deposits of soil
2. principles from which other truths can be derived;

auth_sentence.content: The triumph proved the bedrock for a stellar season.

auth_sentence.content: Carefully regulated tourism is the bedrock of the economy.

auth_sentence.content: This social contract is the bedrock of civilised society.
auth_sentence.res_content: This social contract is the bedrock of civilised society.

Sentence.sentence: Unlike floating ice shelves which have little impact on sea level when they break up, the ice sheet is anchored to bedrock will blow the sea surface.
